item.description:
Join Boston By Foot and Common Boston as we explore the Seaport district and vibrant Fort Point Channel neighborhood, recently nominated for the National Register of Historic Places. Fort Point, a once-forgotten industrial area, is now the home of New England’s largest artistic community. These areas are also the focus of dynamic real estate development and fascinating visions for the community’s future.

This tour is being held in conjunction with Common Boston and they would like you to pre-register with them for the tour. If you plan on attending (really, not a "I might get there"!) please email fpc@commonboston.org.

Common Boston expanding public awareness of the Boston area’s built environment through interactive programs; encouraging collaboration between design professionals and those for whom they design; and
promoting good citizenship and action toward a better built environment.

And hey gang, this one is free!!!
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at Information Kiosk - look for BBF badges, bags, shirts, etc.
item.name: Making a Neighborhood out of Fort Point Channel Walking Tour
